intro: Actinochloa ciliata, commonly known as the silky grass or slender grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family, Poaceae. It is characterized by its fine, delicate leaves that are often covered with soft, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, this plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are arranged in spikelets, a common feature among grasses. Actinochloa ciliata is often found in open habitats such as fields, meadows, and along stream banks.
